body: While using Vim, `k` doesn't work as well, not only up arrow.

issue.title: Alacritty randomly closes
issue.body:
Which operating system does the issue occur on? Linux, Fedora 30.

If on linux, are you using X11 or Wayland? X11, i3.

I'm using latest master branch. Mostly while using Vim, Alacritty randomly crashes.

body:
@chrisduerr I did notice an issue with the up arrow key once, but never anything with 'k'.

This does indeed sound like the same issue, sadly I haven't noticed it again in a while, and I have no idea how to reproduce.
@nixpulvis I recommend you to read though #2907. Since this issues are identical imho.
@juchiast would you mind to post `print-events` logs, since iirc you can reliably repro this issue now? Also type some random character(e.g. `a`) for us to understand when the issue start happening.

[Alacritty-8292.log](https://github.com/jwilm/alacritty/files/3767026/Alacritty-8292.log)

[Alacritty-8293.log](https://github.com/jwilm/alacritty/files/3767029/Alacritty-8293.log)

The bug happens on Alacritty-8292.log. 8293 is the other terminal that I use to reproduce the bug. The bug happens on the section after the last `Focused(true)`.

rename.to: Modifier state is wrongly set while switching between windows

body: Updated the description, I think this can be reproduced with glutin-only.
I was also able to repro it occasionally, while I was using X11, pretty strange issue though.

issue.title: Prompt skips after first Lose Window Focus event on latest master (93e87eb)
issue.body:
Which operating system does the issue occur on? Linux Mint 19.2

If on linux, are you using X11 or Wayland? X11

Shell: Zshell

After the first lose-focus event, input events aren't properly handled by alacritty. Regular keystrokes are generally lost and the terminal experience becomes quite stuttered.

Please see below for screen / key cast for a simple example of how "Enter" is affected after the first Lose Window Focus event:

![prompt-skips](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3723671/68127413-d8369d80-fee3-11e9-9629-e43a0e2d73a6.gif)

issue.title: X11 reporting modifiers after release

labels.name: DS - x11
labels.description: Affects the X11 backend, or generally free Unix platforms

repository.name: winit
repository.description: Window handling library in pure Rust

issue.body:
It looks like in some cases the state of modifiers is not released correctly, leading to key events having incorrect modifiers attached.

More detail can be found in https://github.com/jwilm/alacritty/issues/2906.

body: Well, I have a similar issue on Wayland.
